playn.core.gl

Interface GLBuffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    GLBuffer.Float, GLBuffer.Short
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL20Buffer, GL20Buffer.FloatImpl, GL20Buffer.ShortImpl

    public interface GLBuffer
    An abstraction over bulk buffers for use with GLShader and GLProgram.

    A note on the array methods: on the Android and Java backends, the buffers are backed by an NIO buffer but the staging array is used to avoid repeated calls to Buffer.put which are very slow on Android. Since we have to use this backing array, we expose it directly so that shaders can obtain a reference to it and populate it directly rather than call dozens of methods to add floats one by one. On iOS, the buffer is backed by an array directly, so this API affords slightly higher performance on iOS as well.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  GLBuffer.Float
      A buffer of 32-bit floats.
      static interface  GLBuffer.Short
      A buffer of 16-bit unsigned integers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bind(int target)
      Issues the GL call to bind this buffer.
      int byteSize()
      The size of the data in this buffer, in bytes.
      int capacity()
      Returns the total capacity of this buffer (number of floats, shorts, etc.
      void destroy()
      Releases any GL resources used by this buffer.
      void expand(int capacity)
      Expands the buffer to accommodate the specified new capacity.
      void flush()
      Flushes this buffer's staging array to its underlying NIO buffer (if any).
      int position()
      Returns the current position of the buffer pointer (which is also the number of elements currently occupied in the buffer).
      void reset()
      Resets this buffer's position to zero.
      int send(int target, int usage)
      Sends this buffer's data to GL, using glBufferData.
      void skip(int count)
      Advances the position of this buffer without writing any data to it.

    • Method Detail

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Returns the total capacity of this buffer (number of floats, shorts, etc. it can hold).

      • position

        int position()
        Returns the current position of the buffer pointer (which is also the number of elements currently occupied in the buffer).

      • byteSize

        int byteSize()
        The size of the data in this buffer, in bytes.

      • skip

        void skip(int count)
        Advances the position of this buffer without writing any data to it.

      • expand

        void expand(int capacity)
        Expands the buffer to accommodate the specified new capacity.

      • bind

        void bind(int target)
        Issues the GL call to bind this buffer.

      • send

        int send(int target,
       int usage)
        Sends this buffer's data to GL, using glBufferData. A call to bind(int) must precede this call. This resets the buffer offset to zero and prepares the buffer for the accumulation of new elements.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the buffer at the time it was bound.

      • flush

        void flush()
        Flushes this buffer's staging array to its underlying NIO buffer (if any). This is done automatically on a call to send(int, int).

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets this buffer's position to zero.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Releases any GL resources used by this buffer. The buffer may not be used subsequently.
